model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Have you talked to your advisor about your career options? Teaching is probably a good idea since it is a more guaranteed job.
Speaker B: Yes, I did talk to my advisor and it was very stressful. Deciding my whole life when I am really unsure! But I think I will get into teaching, it is a stable career.
Speaker A: It sounds like something that you would really like and be good at! I hope it works out. I would love to teach robotics someday.
Speaker B: That is so cool, you must be really smart! I imagine your parents are so proud.
Speaker A: Well I'm studying computer science and learning a lot! My parents are great, they are very supportive. What subject would you want to teach?
Speaker B: I would probably teach English, just because that is most in line with what I am studying. However, I have recently started becoming more interested in history so that is also an option.
Speaker A: Yes I think history is interesting, too! Both of those subjects would be great because there are probably lots of teaching jobs. What kind of history do you like?
Speaker B: I love all sorts of history. Right now I am really getting into the weeds of World War II. There's so much to unpack.
Speaker A: For sure! So much happened and it really affected how the world is today. I like learning about the history of places where I have lived, it's really interesting.
Speaker B: That sounds really cool! What have you learned about where you currently live?

[MEMORY]
Speaker A is working at a pizza shop to pay for college and studying computer science. This has led Speaker A to develop an interest in teaching computer science, specifically in the field of robotics.
Speaker B is majoring in linguistics and hopes to turn it into a practical job. This has changed as Speaker B is considering getting a masters degree after completing their bachelors and potentially becoming a college professor in linguistics.

memory_text:
Speaker A is working at a pizza shop to pay for college and studying computer science. This has led Speaker A to develop an interest in teaching computer science, specifically in the field of robotics.
Speaker B is majoring in linguistics and hopes to turn it into a practical job. This has changed as Speaker B is considering getting a masters degree after completing their bachelors and potentially becoming a college professor in linguistics.
speaker: Speaker A
raw_prediction: I've learned a lot about the history of this town, especially how it developed from a small settlement to a bustling city. It's fascinating to see how far we've come.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory provides useful background information about Speaker A's job and study as well as Speaker B's academic plans but the information from the past does not seem directly beneficial in responding to Speaker B's last question. 
Judgement: N/A
